chargeHist.descr: Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)

result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael J Trelka was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)3rd, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 343.44(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Bond on file to be applied. Any balance due, pay within 60 days or you will need to set up a payment plan. Payment plan enrollments are in person on Monday of each week.

records.addlTxt: Transcript of Sentencing Hearing held on September 29, 2015

2:46 p.m. Defendant Michael J Trelka in court with attorney Leon Stanley Schmidt. Defendant Michael J Trelka in custody. ADA Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Cases heard today are 13CF330, 14CF42, 14CF123, and 14CF249.  Parties have received and reviewed the PSI report. ADA Knaapen state prison sentencing recommendations. 
3:12 p.m. Atty Schmidt states probation sentencing recommendations.
3:29 p.m. Defendant makes statements to the Court.

BTC:****
13CF330 Count 1 OWI (4th w/in 5 yrs): 2 yrs Incarceration and  2 yr Extended Supervision - eligible for substance abuse program and not eligible for the Challenge program.
$1,800 fine + costs + DNA surcharge
$26.45 Blood draw cost.
36 mo revocation of Driver's License
36 mo IID
Conditions: 
Use no name other than "Michael Trelka" for the duration of the time that you are with Dept of Corrections.
Maintain absolute sobriety.
 Do not possess or consume alcohol or be on premises where alcohol is served/sold as its primary business except within scope of your employment.
Complete and AODA assessment and compy with recommendations.
Comply with any other assessments, treatment, and programming as deemed appropriate by the Compas assessment and the Dept of Corrections.
Sign release of information forms for offender's assessment(s), and/or treatment.
Obtain and maintain full-time employment or be enrolled in and attend school full time, or a combination of both resulting in full time.
No contact with anyone consuming alcoholic beverages without the Agent's prior permission.
Submit DNA sample, if not already done so
Pay all court ordered financial obligation in full 90 days prior to discharge and 25% of all moneys deposited into the defendants prison account shall be applied to the payment of fines, costs & restitution in this file.  If any fines, costs & restitution remain outstanding at the end of the confinement portion of this sentence, then the remaining balances shall be paid as a condition of extended supervision..
150 days credit

13CF330 Count 3: 6 mo Jail, concurrent. Pay costs + DNA Surcharge.
13CF330 Count 4: 5 days jail, concurrent. Pay costs + DNA surcharge.

14CF42 Count 1:   20 days jail, concurrent with 13CF330. Pay costs.

14CF123 Count 1: $1,000 fine + costs + DNA surcharge
14CF123 Count 3: 6 mo jail, concurrent with 13CF330 and 14CF42. Pay costs.
14CF123 Count 4: 30 day jail, concurrent with Ct 1 & 3, 13CF330, and 14CF42. Pay costs.

14CF249 Count 1 (OWI 5th): 2 yrs Incarceration and  3 yr Extended Supervision, consecutive to 13CF330. - eligible for substance abuse program and not eligible for the Challenge program. (No credit as was applied to 13CF330).
$1,800 fine + costs  to be paid during his sentence and 25% of all moneys deposited into the defendants prison account shall be applied to the payment of fines, costs & restitution in this file.  If any fines, costs & restitution remain outstanding at the end of the confinement portion of this sentence, then the remaining balances shall be paid as a condition of extended supervision..
$26.45 Blood Draw costs.
36 mo Revocation of Driver's License
36 mo IID
14CF249 Count 3: 6 mo jail, concurrent with ct 1, but consecutive to the other files (13CF330). Pay costs.
14CF249 Count 4: 6 mo jail, concurrent with ct 1 and ct 3. Pay costs.

Bonds in files to be applied to all files. 
Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence provided.
Sentencing hearing at 09-29-2015 02:30 pm

Defendant Michael J Trelka in court with attorney Leon Stanley Schmidt. Defendant Michael J Trelka in custody. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Cases heard at this time are: 13CF-330, 14CF-42, 15CF-10, 14CF-249, 14CF-123, 14CF-86, 14TR-123, 14TR-122, 14TR-121, 14TR-2456, 14TR-2457, 14TR-965, 14TR-966, 14TR-964 and 14TR-967.

8:35 AM Court calls cases.
Atty Knaapen states appearances.

Atty Knaapen has provided the Court and Clerk an agreement of anticipation of a plea. State is recommending a prison so parties are not anticipating doing a sentencing today, anticipating a PSI. Atty Schmidt concurs.  

Atty Knaapen states plea agreement for the record. 
13CF-330 - Defendant will plead to Count 1. Count 2 would be dismissed. Count 3 and Count 4 Defendant would plead to. Count 5 would be dismissed and read in. Defense free to argue.
14CF-42 - Defendant will plead to Count 1. This would be a third offense. Count 2 and 3 would be dismissed and read in. Defense free to argue.
14CF-86 - Would be dismissed and read in.
14CF-123 - Defendant will plead ot Count 1 and Count 3 and Count 4 (would be come a 4th offense). Counts 2 and 5 would be dismissed and read in. Defense free to argue.
14CF-249 - Defendant will plead to Count 1. Count 2 would be dismissed. Defendant will plead to Count 3 and Count 4. Counts 5, 6, 7 and 8 would be dismissed and read in. Defense free to argue.
15CF-10 - State intends to dismiss and read in all 6 counts. An initial appearance needs to be held in this case.
All the TR files will be dismissed and read in.

Atty Schmidt concurs.
Defendant concurs.

Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.

15CF-10: Initial Appearance.
Atty Schmidt has received a copy of the complaint, waives reading.
Court informs Defendant of charges and penalties.
Defendant waives reading of complaint.
Defendant waives right to preliminary hearing.
Court questions Defendant regarding waiver of preliminary hearing.
Court questions Atty Schmidt.
Court binds Defendant over for trial.
Atty Schmidt enters pleas of NOT GUILTY to all counts.
Court accepts the pleas.

Court informs Defendant of charges and penalites.

Defendant enters a plea of: 
13CF-330: Count 1: GUILTY
13CF-330: Count 3: GUILTY
13CF-330: Count 4: GUILTY
14CF-042: Count 1: GUILTY - amended to 3rd offense
14CF-123: Count 1: GUILTY
14CF-123: Count 3: GUILTY
14CF-123: Count 4: GUILTY - amended to 4th offense
14CF-249: Count 1: GUILTY
14CF-249: Count 3: GUILTY
14CF-249: Count 4: GUILTY

Court questions Defendant regarding pleas.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney Schmidt for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Both attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charges.

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charges.
Court finds the defendant guilty.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.

13CF-330: Count 4 Operating After Revocation 2nd Offense

14CF-249: Count 1 OWI 5th offense

14CF-249: Count 4 Felony Bailjumping
14CF-249: Count 5 Dismissed and Read In

14CF-249: Count 8 Dismissed and Read In

14TR-2457: Dismissed and Read In

Parties are requesting a PSI.

BY THE COURT:
Court will order a PSI.
Copies are to be provided to the parties at least a week before the sentencing hearing.

State requests the Court to revoke bonds.

BY THE COURT:
Court will revoke bonds.

Atty Schmidt addresses the Court, housekeeping matter.

9:20 AM Court is in recess.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for September 29, 2015 at 02:30 pm.

Defendant Michael J Trelka appeared by video. Prosecuting Atty David R. Knaapen appeared for State of Wisconsin.
Cases heard at this time are:
13CF-330, 14CF-42, 14CF-86, 14CF-123, 14CF-249 and 15CF-10.

1:03 PM Court calls cases.
Atty Knaapen states apperances.

Atty Knaapen addresses the Court, 14CF-249 was set for a jury trial yesterday.  All the cases heard yesterday were ordered warrants and bonds forfeited.

Defendant has not been in compliance with pretrial supervision program recently.

State requests $25,000 cash bond, to cover all the files, in addition to any cash that was posted.

Court addresses the TR files. 

Atty Knaapen addresses the Court, a plea hearing is set for July 16th at 8:30 am, which was established yesterday after Defendant was in custody.
Plea hearing at 07-16-2015 08:30 am
of Bail/Bond Forfeiture
Judicial Review Request 7/9/15 az

Attorney Leon Stanley Schmidt in court. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
All cases heard at this time are: 13CF-330, 14CF-42, 14CF-86, 14CF-123, 14CF-249, 15CF-10, 14TR-121, 14TR-122, 14TR-123, 14TR-964, 14TR-965, 14TR-966, 14TR-967, 14TR-2456 and 14TR-2457.

9:21 AM Court calls cases.
Atty Knaapen states appearances.

Defendant does not appear but Defense does appear.

Atty Schmidt addresses the Court, does not know exactly where he is. Defendant made it to the courthouse this morning, but ended up being afraid to come into the courthouse and ended up driving away.  Defendant would not come out.  Atty Schmidt talked with his client on the phone after he left, could not get him to come in.  Defendant is just afraid to come into the courthouse, is having a hard time coming to grips with the situation, lost 50 pounds.  Defendant's family is trying to get his client here.

Atty Knaapen addresses the Court, State requests warrants.

14CF-249 was set for a jury trial today. Court did have a telephone conference with the attorneys yesterday out of the concern Defendant was not going to appear.  Court then set this matter for an appearance and cancelled the jury trial. 

BY THE COURT:
14CF-249: Court authorizes bench warrant for arrest. Any bonds posted are forfeited.
Court authorizes warrant on all criminal files, all bonds forfeited. 

Atty Schmidt states that the TR files can be handled with Atty Knaapen. 

Court will set all the TR files for a pretrial date. 

Atty Schmidt replies. 

All the TR cases will be set for a pretrial on October 12, 2015 at 8:30 AM Branch 1.

9:31 AM Court is in recess.
Status conference on July 9, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant Record Update
Pre-trial conference on February 16, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Pre-trial conference on February 6, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Michael J Trelka in court with attorney Leon Stanley Schmidt.   David Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Cases heard today are 13CF330, 14CF42, 14CF86, 14CF123 and 14CF249.

8:31 a.m.  Court calls case.
Atty Knaapen states the appearances.

Atty Schmidt makes statements that they have run into a snag and informs that the defendant would like a trial on the OWI 5th. 
Atty Knaapen makes statements that defendant is out on bond on an OWI.
Atty Schmidt makes additional statements regarding the OWI 5th and family members informing defendant to have a trial on 14CF249.
Atty Schmidt is hoping to get this case on quickly for a trial.
Atty Schmidt states for the record that they will be trying 14CF249 counts 1 & 2 at the Trial.
Atty Knaapen states that they will try all counts on 14CF249 not just 1 & 2.

BY THE COURT:
Trial to be set for February 6, 2015 for one day, starting at 8:30 a.m. 
Jury Instructions should be filed with the Court by January 28, 2015.
Final Pre-Trial to be set for December 15, 2014 at 9:30 a.m.

Court questions the defendant.

Bond previously set on 13CF330, 14CF42, and 14CF86.

11:44 AM Court calls case.

13CF-330 and 14CF-42 have been set for a plea or arraignment. 14CF-86 was a new file, anticipating an initial appearance.

Defendant has been in the pretrial supervision program since August.

TR cases will be resolved by stipulation

Court authorizes Criminal Warrant for Arrest

Arraignment on March 3, 2014 at 11:30 am.

Defendant Michael J Trelka in court with attorney Leon S Schmidt. Cass Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Cases heard are 14CF-42, 14TR-121, 122 and 123.

9:04 AM Court calls cases.
Atty Cousins states appearances.

Court informs Defendant of charges and penalties.
Atty Schmidt has not completed a waiver of preliminary hearing, but has discussed this with his client.

Court questions Defendant regarding waiver of preliminary hearing.
Defendant has a high school diploma, has a full time job, can read and write the english language.
Defendant understands the charges and penalties.
  
Court questions Attorney Schmidt.

State does not have an information to file.

NOT GUILTY pleas are entered for all cases/charges.

Court accepts the not guilty plea.
